Events.year: 43 BC – Battle of Forum Gallorum: Mark Antony, besieging Caesar's assassin Decimus Brutus in Mutina, defeats the forces of the consul Pansa, but is then immediately defeated by the army of the other consul, Aulus Hirtius.[1]

Events.year: AD 69 – Vitellius, commander of the Rhine armies, defeats Emperor Otho in the Battle of Bedriacum to take power over Rome.[2]
Events.html: AD 69 – Vitellius, commander of the Rhine armies, defeats Emperor Otho in the Battle of Bedriacum to take power over Rome.[2]

Events.year: AD 70 – Siege of Jerusalem: Titus, son of emperor Vespasian, surrounds the Jewish capital with four Roman legions.
Events.html: AD 70 – Siege of Jerusalem: Titus, son of emperor Vespasian, surrounds the Jewish capital with four Roman legions.

Events.year: 193 – Septimius Severus is proclaimed Roman emperor by the army in Illyricum (in the Balkans).
Events.html: 193 – Septimius Severus is proclaimed Roman emperor by the army in Illyricum (in the Balkans).

Events.year: 966 – After his marriage to the Christian Doubravka of Bohemia, the pagan ruler of the Polans, Mieszko I, converts to Christianity, an event considered to be the founding of the Polish state.
Events.html: 966 – After his marriage to the Christian Doubravka of Bohemia, the pagan ruler of the Polans, Mieszko I, converts to Christianity, an event considered to be the founding of the Polish state.

Events.year: 972 – Co-Emperor Otto II, a son of Otto I (the Great), marries the Byzantine princess Theophanu. She is crowned empress by Pope John XIII at Rome.
Events.html: 972 – Co-Emperor Otto II, a son of Otto I (the Great), marries the Byzantine princess Theophanu. She is crowned empress by Pope John XIII at Rome.

Events.year: 1028 – Henry III, son of Conrad, is elected King of Germany.
Events.html: 1028 – Henry III, son of Conrad, is elected King of Germany.

Events.year: 1205 – Battle of Adrianople between Bulgarians and Crusaders.
Events.html: 1205 – Battle of Adrianople between Bulgarians and Crusaders.

Events.year: 1294 – Temür, grandson of Kublai, is elected Khagan of the Mongols and Emperor of the Yuan dynasty with the reigning titles Oljeitu and Chengzong.
Events.html: 1294 – Temür, grandson of Kublai, is elected Khagan of the Mongols and Emperor of the Yuan dynasty with the reigning titles Oljeitu and Chengzong.

Events.year: 1341 – Sack of Saluzzo (Italy) by Italian-Angevine troops under Manfred V, Marquess of Saluzzo.
Events.html: 1341 – Sack of Saluzzo (Italy) by Italian-Angevine troops under Manfred V, Marquess of Saluzzo.

Events.year: 1434 – The foundation stone of Nantes Cathedral, France is laid.
Events.html: 1434 – The foundation stone of Nantes Cathedral, France is laid.

Events.year: 1471 – In England, the Yorkists under Edward IV defeat the Lancastrians under the Earl of Warwick at the Battle of Barnet; the Earl is killed and Edward IV resumes the throne.
Events.html: 1471 – In England, the Yorkists under Edward IV defeat the Lancastrians under the Earl of Warwick at the Battle of Barnet; the Earl is killed and Edward IV resumes the throne.

Events.year: 1561 – A celestial phenomenon is reported over Nuremberg, described as an aerial battle.
Events.html: 1561 – A celestial phenomenon is reported over Nuremberg, described as an aerial battle.

Events.year: 1639 – Imperial forces are defeated by the Swedes at the Battle of Chemnitz. The Swedish victory prolongs the Thirty Years' War and allows them to advance into Bohemia.
Events.html: 1639 – Imperial forces are defeated by the Swedes at the Battle of Chemnitz. The Swedish victory prolongs the Thirty Years' War and allows them to advance into Bohemia.

Events.year: 1699 – Khalsa: The Sikh religion was formalised as the Khalsa
Events.text: the brotherhood of Warrior-Saints - by Guru Gobind Singh in northern India, in accordance with the Nanakshahi calendar.
Events.html: 1699 – Khalsa: The Sikh religion was formalised as the Khalsa - the brotherhood of Warrior-Saints - by Guru Gobind Singh in northern India, in accordance with the Nanakshahi calendar.

Events.year: 1775 – The first abolition society in North America is established. The Society for the Relief of Free Negroes Unlawfully Held in Bondage is organized in Philadelphia by Benjamin Franklin and Benjamin Rush.
Events.html: 1775 – The first abolition society in North America is established. The Society for the Relief of Free Negroes Unlawfully Held in Bondage is organized in Philadelphia by Benjamin Franklin and Benjamin Rush.

Events.year: 1816 – Bussa, a slave in British-ruled Barbados, leads a slave rebellion and is killed. For this, he is remembered as the first national hero of Barbados.
Events.html: 1816 – Bussa, a slave in British-ruled Barbados, leads a slave rebellion and is killed. For this, he is remembered as the first national hero of Barbados.

Events.year: 1828 – Noah Webster copyrights the first edition of his dictionary.
Events.html: 1828 – Noah Webster copyrights the first edition of his dictionary.

Events.html: 1849 – Hungary declares itself independent of Austria with Lajos Kossuth as its leader.

Events.year: 1865 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is shot in Ford's Theatre by John Wilkes Booth; Lincoln died the next day.
Events.html: 1865 – U.S. President Abraham Lincoln is shot in Ford's Theatre by John Wilkes Booth; Lincoln died the next day.

Events.year: 1890 – The Pan-American Union is founded by the First International Conference of American States in Washington, D.C.
Events.html: 1890 – The Pan-American Union is founded by the First International Conference of American States in Washington, D.C.

Events.year: 1894 – The first ever commercial motion picture house opened in New York City using ten Kinetoscopes, a device for peep-show viewing of films.

Events.year: 1900 – The Exposition Universelle begins.

Events.html: 1902 – James Cash Penney opens his first store in Kemmerer, Wyoming.[3]

Events.html: 1906 – The Azusa Street Revival opens and will launch Pentecostalism as a worldwide movement.

Events.year: 1908 – Hauser Dam, a steel dam on the Missouri River in Montana, U.S., fails, sending a surge of water 25 to 30 feet (7.6 to 9.1 m) high downstream.
Events.html: 1908 – Hauser Dam, a steel dam on the Missouri River in Montana, U.S., fails, sending a surge of water 25 to 30 feet (7.6 to 9.1 m) high downstream.

Events.html: 1909 – A massacre is organized by the Ottoman Empire against the Armenian population of Cilicia.

Events.html: 1912 – The British passenger liner RMS Titanic hits an iceberg in the North Atlantic at 23:40 (sinks morning of April 15th).

Events.year: 1927 – The first Volvo car premieres in Gothenburg, Sweden.
Events.html: 1927 – The first Volvo car premieres in Gothenburg, Sweden.

Events.year: 1928 – The Bremen, a German Junkers W 33 type aircraft, reaches Greenly Island, Canada
Events.text: the first successful transatlantic aeroplane flight from east to west.
Events.html: 1928 – The Bremen, a German Junkers W 33 type aircraft, reaches Greenly Island, Canada - the first successful transatlantic aeroplane flight from east to west.

Events.year: 1931 – The Spanish Cortes deposes King Alfonso XIII and proclaims the Second Spanish Republic.
Events.html: 1931 – The Spanish Cortes deposes King Alfonso XIII and proclaims the Second Spanish Republic.

Events.year: 1939 – The Grapes of Wrath, by American author John Steinbeck is first published by the Viking Press.
Events.html: 1939 – The Grapes of Wrath, by American author John Steinbeck is first published by the Viking Press.

Events.year: 1940 – World War II: Royal Marines land in Namsos, Norway in preparation for a larger force to arrive two days later.
Events.html: 1940 – World War II: Royal Marines land in Namsos, Norway in preparation for a larger force to arrive two days later.

Events.year: 1941 – World War II: German general Erwin Rommel attacks Tobruk.
Events.html: 1941 – World War II: German general Erwin Rommel attacks Tobruk.

Events.year: 1942 – Malta receives the George Cross for its gallantry. The George Cross was given by King George VI himself and is now an emblem on the Maltese national flag.
Events.html: 1942 – Malta receives the George Cross for its gallantry. The George Cross was given by King George VI himself and is now an emblem on the Maltese national flag.

Events.year: 1944 – Bombay explosion: A massive explosion in Bombay harbor kills 300 and causes economic damage valued then at 20 million pounds.
Events.html: 1944 – Bombay explosion: A massive explosion in Bombay harbor kills 300 and causes economic damage valued then at 20 million pounds.

Events.year: 1945 – Razing of Friesoythe: The 4th Canadian (Armoured) Division deliberately destroyed the German town of Friesoythe on the orders of Major General Christopher Vokes.
Events.html: 1945 – Razing of Friesoythe: The 4th Canadian (Armoured) Division deliberately destroyed the German town of Friesoythe on the orders of Major General Christopher Vokes.

Events.year: 1958 – The Soviet satellite Sputnik 2 falls from orbit after a mission duration of 162 days. This was the first spacecraft to carry a living animal, a female dog named Laika, who likely lived only a few hours.
Events.html: 1958 – The Soviet satellite Sputnik 2 falls from orbit after a mission duration of 162 days. This was the first spacecraft to carry a living animal, a female dog named Laika, who likely lived only a few hours.

Events.year: 1967 – Gnassingbé Eyadéma overthrows President of Togo Nicolas Grunitzky and installs himself as the new president, a title he would hold for the next 38 years.
